learning_outcomes.description: Identify a research topic within the field of Museum Studies.
Plan and carry out research within the field of Museum Studies.
Access, evaluate and critique primary and secondary sources.
Develop an argument critically and clearly.
Organise and present written research at a postgraduate level.

assessments.task_description: Students are to submit a 3-5 page thesis outline to the dissertation supervisor and the course coordinator, including research question, methodology, key literature, timeframe, and structure.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are to submit a 3-5 page thesis outline to the dissertation supervisor and the course coordinator via email and load via Turnitin on the course Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
A dissertation of 10,000 - 12,000 words.

Marking criteria and/or marking rubrics are available in the ‘Assessment’ folder in Blackboard for this course. 

AI Use: This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You must submit your assignment electronically by the due time, on the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
How to complete your thesis

This seminar will provide students with an overview of what is expected from a thesis and the process of creating one.

**Due to the University-wide closures in response to Cyclone Alfred, this week’s seminar has been postponed. Please refer to the course Blackboard site for the revised schedule**


Learning outcomes: L01, L02

Students are to submit a 3-5 page thesis outline to the thesis supervisor and the course coordinator by this date, including research question, methodology, key literature, timeframe, and structure.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04, L05
